pageContext.claim: “The Wall Street Journal always 'forgets”'to mention that the ratings for the White House Press Briefings are 'through the roof' (Monday Night Football, Bachelor Finale, according to @nytimes) & is only way for me to escape the Fake News & get my views across. WSJ is Fake News!”
pageContext.analysis: Hmmm, the New York Times is "fake news" -- except when it runs an article that favorably compares viewership for Trump's coronavirus briefings. "But those ratings have faded over time, and networks are more reluctant to air them in their entirety, no doubt given Trump’s proclivity for redirecting them away from a focus on the coronavirus and onto praise for his administration," noted our colleague Philip Bump. But Trump keeps tweeting as if the initial burst of interest held steady.
